Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.ldap.client

Interface StartTLSResultHandler

  • public interface StartTLSResultHandler
    Handler for STARTTLS extended operation results.

    This handler receives the result of a STARTTLS request, which upgrades the connection to use TLS encryption.

    On success, the handler receives an LDAPPostTLS interface and should proceed to bind (credentials are now protected).

    Author:
    Chris Burdess
    See Also:
    LDAPConnected.startTLS(org.bluezoo.gumdrop.ldap.client.StartTLSResultHandler), LDAPPostTLS

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void handleStartTLSFailure​(LDAPResult result, LDAPConnected connection)
      Called when STARTTLS fails.
      void handleTLSEstablished​(LDAPPostTLS postTLS)
      Called when TLS is successfully established.

    • Method Detail

      • handleTLSEstablished

        void handleTLSEstablished​(LDAPPostTLS postTLS)
        Called when TLS is successfully established.

        The connection is now encrypted. The handler should proceed to bind to authenticate.

        Parameters:
        postTLS - operations available after TLS upgrade

      • handleStartTLSFailure

        void handleStartTLSFailure​(LDAPResult result,
                           LDAPConnected connection)
        Called when STARTTLS fails.

        This may occur if:

        • The server does not support STARTTLS
        • TLS handshake fails
        • Certificate validation fails

        The handler can choose to continue without TLS (if acceptable) or close the connection.

        Parameters:
        result - the failure result
        connection - operations to continue or close
